market_analysis.market_question: Will Hamas release any more hostages by October 12?

prediction.reasoning_summary: All credible sources confirm hostage release is scheduled for Monday morning (October 13), which is AFTER the market resolution deadline of October 12 at 11:59 PM ET. Multiple officials including Israeli government spokesman and Hamas officials have confirmed the Monday morning timeline.
prediction.detailed_reasoning: The market asks if Hamas will release hostages BY October 12, 2025. Based on comprehensive analysis of all available sources: (1) The 72-hour ceasefire window started Friday October 11 at noon and ends Monday October 13 at noon. (2) Israeli PMO spokeswoman Shosh Bedrosian explicitly stated hostages will be released 'early Monday morning'. (3) Hamas official Osama Hamdan confirmed to AFP that releases will begin 'Monday morning'. (4) CNN reports the 20 living hostages will be released 'early on Monday morning, all at the same time'. (5) Times of Israel reports 'release expected to begin Monday morning'. (6) No sources indicate any possibility of release on October 12. The market closes October 12 at 11:59 PM ET, which is before the scheduled Monday morning release. Therefore, NO is the correct outcome with very high confidence.

sources.title: Release of hostages set to begin Monday morning
sources.excerpt: The IDF completed its withdrawal by noon on Friday, commencing the 72-hour period
key_quotes: Hamas was given a window of 72 hours after the withdrawal to release the 48 hostages

key_events.description: Hostage release scheduled for early Monday morning (October 13). All officials confirm Monday timeline.

sources.excerpt: Hamas leader Osama Hamdan confirmed that the release of 48 hostages will begin on Monday morning
key_quotes: According to the signed agreement, the prisoner exchange is set to begin on Monday morning as agreed

sources.excerpt: Israel is expecting Hamas to hand over all 20 surviving hostages early Monday morning
key_quotes: Spokeswoman Shosh Bedrosian said Israel is expecting Hamas to hand over all 20 surviving hostages to the International Committee of the Red Cross early Monday morning

key_events.description: President Trump expected to arrive in Israel Monday morning for hostage reception and Knesset address

sources.title: Preparations for hostage release underway ahead of Trump visit

positive_indicators: Multiple official confirmations of Monday release
Hamas and Israel coordinating with Red Cross
Trump traveling to region for historic moment
negative_indicators: Release scheduled AFTER market close (October 13 vs October 12)
Some uncertainty about locating all deceased hostages
Market currently pricing YES at 61.5% despite clear Monday timeline
neutral_indicators: 2,000 Palestinian prisoners to be released in exchange

market_sentiment.mispricing_reason: Traders appear to be confusing the ceasefire timeline (started Oct 11) with the actual hostage release date (Oct 13). The market is pricing YES at 61.5% despite unanimous confirmation from all sources that release is Monday morning, after market close.

risk_factors.description: Unexpected early release on October 12 before market close
risk_factors.mitigation: Monitor breaking news throughout October 12. Set alerts for 'Hamas hostages released' keywords.

risk_factors.description: Unreported release already occurred that hasn't hit major news yet
risk_factors.mitigation: Cross-reference Israeli, Palestinian, and international sources continuously

risk_factors.description: Low liquidity at favorable NO prices due to mispricing awareness
risk_factors.mitigation: Use limit orders, be prepared for rapid price movements if news clarifies timing

risk_factors.description: Last-minute changes to release timeline due to political considerations
risk_factors.mitigation: Monitor official statements from Israeli PMO and Hamas leadership

trading_recommendation.notes: Extremely strong edge based on clear timeline mismatch. All sources unanimously confirm Monday morning release, market closes tonight. Current YES price of 61.5% represents significant mispricing. Market closes in ~9 hours. Risk is minimal - only early surprise release could invalidate prediction.

alternative_scenarios.scenario: Surprise early release on October 12 evening
alternative_scenarios.impact_on_prediction: Would invalidate NO prediction, but extremely unlikely given universal confirmation of Monday timeline

alternative_scenarios.scenario: Release occurs as scheduled Monday morning October 13
trigger_events: Coordinated handover to Red Cross Monday morning
alternative_scenarios.impact_on_prediction: Base case scenario - strongly supported by all official sources
Also results in NO for this market, since question is by October 12

metadata.analyst_notes: Exceptionally strong conviction trade. The timeline mismatch is unambiguous - market asks for release BY Oct 12, all sources confirm Oct 13. Market is significantly mispriced at 61.5% YES. This represents one of the clearest arbitrage opportunities when fundamental facts contradict market pricing.
